title: PTD Today — Media

items.title: Build your first GraphRAG Powered Agent! (No Graph Expert Required) | Databases for AI

ai.summary: Based on the available description, the session argues that valuable knowledge trapped in docs, PDFs, and wikis is inaccessible to models and that knowledge graphs can unlock that information. It promises a live demo showing how to build a knowledge graph in an afternoon using familiar AI tools and real documents—no six-month project required.
bullets: Knowledge in docs, PDFs, and wikis is often inaccessible to AI models.
Knowledge graphs can unlock that knowledge for reasoning.
Building a knowledge graph is presented as achievable in an afternoon, not a massive undertaking.
The approach uses the same AI tools teams already use.
Session includes a live demo with real documents; no six‑month project required.
takeaways: Make technical and operational documents accessible to AI to surface institutional knowledge.
Prototype a knowledge-graph-backed solution quickly instead of committing to long projects.
Leverage existing AI tooling to lower adoption barriers for knowledge-graph initiatives.
Use a live-demo on real documents to validate value before scaling.

items.title: Watch Live: Fed Chair Jerome Powell Holds News Conference | WSJ

ai.summary: Based on the available description… Federal Reserve Chair Jerome Powell speaks to reporters following the Federal Reserve's two-day policy-setting meeting. The video presents his remarks to reporters in the immediate aftermath of that meeting.
bullets: Speaker: Federal Reserve Chair Jerome Powell
Context: following the Fed's two-day policy-setting meeting
Format: remarks to reporters (post-meeting)
Transcript: no transcript available in the provided content
takeaways: Monitor the conference for any guidance on monetary policy that could affect borrowing costs relevant to financing data center projects.
Review near-term capital-expenditure and expansion plans in case policymakers signal changes that influence interest rates or financing conditions.
Watch for policy cues that might affect demand or operating-cost assumptions for grid and data center planning.

items.title: Deutsche Bank accelerates Cloud journeys with Google Cloud Consulting

ai.summary: Based on the available description, Google Cloud Consulting partnered with Deutsche Bank to design novel learning experiences that helped thousands of engineers become fluent in cloud engineering. The program leveraged Generative AI to deliver personalized, interactive training that combines on‑demand convenience with the effectiveness of instructor‑led sessions, with Google Cloud Consulting Learning Services providing the creative innovation and technical expertise to build the Cloud Engineering Program and accelerate Deutsche Bank's cloud journey.
bullets: Deutsche Bank implemented a Cloud Engineering Program developed with Google Cloud Consulting.
Thousands of engineers were trained to become fluent in cloud engineering.
Generative AI was used to create personalized, interactive training experiences.
Training blended on‑demand learning with instructor‑led effectiveness.
Google Cloud Consulting Learning Services provided creative innovation and technical expertise.
takeaways: Workforce readiness at scale is a critical enabler for cloud migration and modernization.
Generative AI can personalize and scale technical training to accelerate skill development.
Blended learning (on‑demand + instructor‑led) can improve training effectiveness for complex cloud skills.
Engaging a consulting partner brings both creative program design and technical implementation expertise to speed cloud initiatives.

items.title: Year-end toolkit: Strengthening audit committee collaboration

ai.summary: Based on the available description… This episode provides finance and governance guidance to help management strengthen collaboration with audit committees during the year-end accounting and reporting cycle. It highlights communication and reporting practices and covers emerging oversight priorities including AI risks and controls, enterprise risk management, cyber risk in the age of AI, and proxy disclosures.
bullets: Strengthening management/audit committee communication and collaboration
Key year-end accounting and reporting issues finance teams should be ready to address
Oversight of AI: risks, opportunities, and controls
Enhancing enterprise risk oversight and cyber risk considerations with AI
Elevating proxy disclosures and streamlined reporting for governance
takeaways: Engage audit committees early on year-end reporting and any transformation initiatives to ensure alignment and smoother oversight.
Be prepared to explain AI use cases, associated risks, and the controls in place — audit committees will expect clear oversight information.
Reinforce enterprise risk management and cyber-risk controls, particularly where AI-driven systems intersect with grid or data center operations.
Ensure proxy and governance disclosures reflect material changes in risk profile or controls so board-level stakeholders have transparent information.

items.title: Zip Up, Clip In, Copilot On

ai.summary: Based on the available description, the video shows Jo discovering the power of Copilot Groups and presents route planning made easy. It highlights Copilot as an AI tool for simplifying routing tasks.
bullets: Focuses on route planning made easy
Centers on Jo discovering Copilot Groups
Highlights the power of Copilot Groups
Positions Copilot as an AI route-planning aid
Uses hashtags: #copilot #microsoftcopilot #ai
takeaways: Based on the description, Copilot Groups could be relevant for route and maintenance planning in grid/data center operations.
Consider evaluating whether AI grouping features can streamline coordination of field teams and site visits.
Check compatibility with existing mapping/GIS and scheduling systems before broader adoption.
Pilot a small use case to measure potential time and cost savings for operational routing tasks.

items.title: Audyt w erze AI: praktyczne zastosowania i realne korzyści | Katarzyna Chojniak, Alicja Barska

ai.summary: Based on the available description, this KPMG ON AIR episode explains how AI is already embedded in audit practice to support repetitive tasks, large-scale data analysis, and decision-making. Katarzyna Chojniak and Alicja Barska describe concrete tools (AI Transaction Scoring Tool, Clara AI, KPMG Clara), the move from sampling to full-population analysis, and related issues around auditor skills, data security, regulation and potential risks.
bullets: AI enables automation of repetitive audit tasks and analysis of full data populations.
Highlighted tools: AI Transaction Scoring Tool, Clara AI conversational assistants/agents, and the KPMG Clara platform (including Clara for Clients).
Shift from sampling to full-population analysis changes audit methodology and auditor roles.
AI supports documentation, disclosure analysis, real-time audit management and client communication.
Key challenges: implementation/adaptation by auditors, data security, regulatory environment and potential AI-related risks.
takeaways: Ensure scalable storage and processing capacity to support full-population analyses driven by AI audit tools.
Prioritize robust data security, access controls and compliance capabilities to meet regulatory expectations for AI-enabled audits.
Enable real-time data integration and APIs to support platforms like KPMG Clara and conversational AI assistants.
Invest in staff upskilling for AI, data analytics and audit-integration workflows to maximize tool value.
Plan for governance and risk controls around AI use to address potential threats and regulatory scrutiny.

items.title: Arknights: Endfield | 4K NVIDIA DLSS 4 Launch Trailer

ai.summary: Based on the available description, Arknights: Endfield has officially launched and the trailer highlights support for NVIDIA DLSS 4 with Multi Frame Generation. The game is a 3D real-time strategy RPG where you play the Endministrator on Talos-II, and the trailer was captured on a GeForce RTX 5080 at 4K Ultra settings using DLSS 4 Multi Frame Generation 4X Mode.
bullets: Arknights: Endfield has officially launched.
Trailer showcases NVIDIA DLSS 4 with Multi Frame Generation.
Game genre: 3D real-time strategy RPG; player role is the Endministrator of Endfield Industries on Talos-II.
Footage captured on GeForce RTX 5080 at 4K Ultra with DLSS 4 MFG 4X Mode.
Description includes official game and NVIDIA GeForce social/website links.
takeaways: The launch trailer explicitly uses DLSS 4 with Multi Frame Generation—verify DLSS4 support requirements when assessing software compatibility.
Capture was performed on an RTX 5080 at 4K Ultra with DLSS4 MFG 4X Mode—check whether your infrastructure has comparable GPUs for high-resolution capture or playback testing.
Titles adopting DLSS4/MFG may require updated drivers and toolchains—confirm driver and SDK readiness in deployment plans.
